Package payroll_processing_system

Class Date

java.lang.Object
payroll_processing_system.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Date>
public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Date>
Date class provides the structure for the Date object, which contains a year, month and day. It also contains informative methods to determine how many days are in each month, and whether a certain Date object is valid. The Book class has a attribute datePublished which is of type Date.
Author:
Hugo De Moraes, Jonathan Dong

    • getFebruaryDays

      private int getFebruaryDays()
      returns the number of days in February based on year attribute of Date object
      Returns:
      29 if year is leap year, 28 if year is not

    • getDaysInMonth

      private int getDaysInMonth()
      calculates number of days in month based off specific month
      Returns:
      number of days in month

    • isValidYear

      private boolean isValidYear()
      checks if year of Date object is valid
      Returns:
      true if year is between 1900 and today's year

    • isValidMonth

      private boolean isValidMonth()
      checks if month of Date object is valid
      Returns:
      true if month is between 1 and 12

    • isValidDay

      private boolean isValidDay()
      checks if day of Date object is valid
      Returns:
      true if day is between 1 and num days in month

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      checks if Date Object is valid
      Returns:
      true if year, month and day is valid

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      overridden toString method gives string representation of Date Object
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      String containing month, day and year of Date
